intro: Silene micropetala, commonly known as the small-petalled catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species with showy, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, pinkish-white inflorescences, blooming in late spring to early summer. Silene micropetala is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in alpine and arid environments.
